comments.value:
Hi Jamie Any chance someone could create me a top level folder called 'Olympic Route Network'? I basically need a replica folder of the Greenwich Park folder with the identical files within it. Would be great if this could be done soon! Thanks Alex Alexandra Brown Marketing Executive (New Media) Communications Olympic Delivery Authority Mailpoint: 7A 23rd Floor, One Churchill Place London E14 5LN Direct line: +44 (0) 203 023 6016 Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000 Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001 www.london2012.com Find out what is going on at London 2012 HQ - http://blog.london2012.com

Hi Alex,

I have created the folder, 

As for the files/subfolders, we can download the files off the main web site via FTP (which will be quicker than doing it individually) and then re-upload them into the CMS, but might not get to do this till tomorrow morning, is that OK?

Jamie

Alex, 

When you say 'identical files within it' do you mean all the HTML pages and the contents of both the /pdf and /document folders?

All the pages are named 'Greenwich Park Something' ?

thanks

Jamie

Hi

 

It might be useful to have everything so I can just see what’s there and I can replace everything with my new content. Am creating a similar site for the Olympic Route Network. The images, documents etc aren’t important though. I can rename everything in the new folder.


Alex

Hi Alex,

I have uploaded everything (html,css,images) bar the PDF's as some of them are quite large and are already in the CMS so if you need them you can just link to the ones in the Greenwich folder or re-upload just the ones you need.

Hope that's ok?

Jamie
Fab! Thank you!

comments.value:
Um, this hasn't happened.  And it REALLY needs to.  If you can't do it this morning, I need to go back to doing it by hand.  Can you please let me know?

-----Original Message-----
From: Jamie Unwin [mailto:jamie@kitsite.com] 
Sent: 09 July 2010 13:12
To: Liz Goulding
Subject: Re: Incorrect dates in Events on London 2012 map.

No, should be fine, see last email, was being overly cautious..

btw. I can do this automatically for you? if you can hold off for an hour..

Jamie

On 9 Jul 2010, at 12:10, Liz Goulding wrote:

> Jamie,
> 
> I am manually going through and adding end-dates to the one day events.  It seems to be working... is it doing something bad?
> 
> Liz
> 
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jamie Unwin [mailto:jamie@kitsite.com] 
> Sent: 09 July 2010 12:03
> To: tom@stamen.com
> Cc: Kieran Topping; mike@stamen.com; Liz Goulding; shawn@stamen.com; deborah@stamen.com
> Subject: Re: Incorrect dates in Events on London 2012 map.
> 
> Thanks Tom,
> 
> It would be preferable for us not to force the end date as I think we may have code on the site that uses the fact that there is no end date to indicate a 1 day event and I can't actually add in a conditional to the endpoint you use (to retrieve the events) as it's our generic one that we keep free of any client specific code.
> 
> But let us know how it's looking in terms of you fixing the swf. If it looks like your going to be pressed to get a fix in in time we could run though all events and just update those without an end date (and keep our fingers crossed it doesn't cause any issue elsewhere). If we did this you would need to to re-retive all the events though.
> 
> Jamie
> 
> On 8 Jul 2010, at 22:19, Tom Carden wrote:
> 
>> Hi Jamie,
>> 
>> I just followed up with Kieran and Liz with a longer diagnosis for the incorrect dates. In summary we're not using the event start date in the map/timeline unless there's a corresponding end date. It all comes through in the API correctly it's just that the swf is falling back to creation date in the absence of a full range.
>> 
>> A quick fix on your end would be to require an end date for all events before sending them over to our API. But I'm talking to Shawn about implementing a fix to the swf as well or instead. We'll keep you posted.
>> 
>> Cheers,
>> 
>> Tom.
>> 
>> 
>> Kieran Topping wrote:
>>> Hi Tom, Mike,
>>> I'm just forwarding this original email to you two, in case you haven't seen it. This appears to still be an issue, independent of the problem with the Edinburgh event.
>>> I am out of the office on Friday, but Jamie (jamie@kitsite.com  can be contacted in my absence.
>>> Kind regards,
>>> Kieran
>>> 
>>> ---------- Forwarded message ----------
>>> From: *Kieran Topping* <kieran@kitsite.com 
>>> Date: Fri, Jul 2, 2010 at 1:46 PM
>>> Subject: Incorrect dates in Events on London 2012 map.
>>> To: shawn@stamen.com 
>>> 
>>> 
>>> Hello Shawn,
>>> 
>>> I'm investigating a problem whereby incorrect dates are appearing in the London2012 map.
>>> 
>>> The easiest way for me to describe the problem is with a screenshot. Please see the attached "MapLondon2012.png". This was generated by performing a search for "Open Weekend 2010" and then clicking on the "5" link to the West of Glasgow.
>>> 
>>> The problem is that the map is displaying the wrong date for the Events. It appears to me that you are using the Event's "creation-date" rather than the "startDate".
>>> 
>>> When you retrieve the Event object via the api, you get some xml looking like this (nb I've removed all but the relevant elements):  
>>> <page id="2912669" name="Discover Dalriada 2010 - Sound of Jura Bike Safari" display-name="Discover Dalriada 2010 - Sound of Jura Bike Safari" section="Events" path="events/discover-dalriada-2010-sound-of-jura-bike-safari.php" filename="discover-dalriada-2010-sound-of-jura-bike-safari.php" template="Event" is-include="false" encoding="utf-8" lang="en" owner="community-frontend" state="Published" flags="100011101000000" creation-date="201006140849" modification-date="201006291205" publication-date="201006291205" first-publication-date="201006181739" language="en">
>>>   ...
>>>   <group iid="300" type="group">
>>>       <startDate iid="131" type="date">20100725</startDate>
>>>   </group>
>>>   ...
>>> </page>
>>> 
>>> It appears to me that you're displaying the creation-date ("201006140849", i.e. "14 June 2010") instead of the startDate ("20100725", i.e. "27 July 2010").
>>> 
>>> Can you confirm whether this is the case please? and also let me know if you'd be able to correct it?
>>> 
>>> Many thanks in advance,
>>> 
>>> Kieran
>>> 
>>> 
>>> 
>> 
>> 
>> -- 
>> tom@stamen.com
>> www.stamen.com
>> 
> 
> ----------------------------------------------
> office: 0207 378 6655
> http://www.kitsite.com/
> 
> Studio 41, Clink Street Studios
> Clink Street
> London
> SE1 9DG
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>

comments.value:
On the event submission form, it says to leave the end date blank if it's happening only one day.  That is the cause of all our problems!  Could you please remove that, and have it say 'enter the same date as the end date if your event is only one day'?

Liz Goulding
Senior New Media Producer
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297
Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000
www.london2012.com
www.twitter.com/london2012
This looks like high priority to me.

Hi Liz,

I'd so much rather we fixed this at Stamens end which sounds like they have done now?

Adding both a start and end date is a bit of hack, which I only agreed to as I was concerned Stamen may not be able to fix the issue at their end. To be honest I probably should have put mu foot down as it's exactly little hacks like this that come back to haunt us a couple of months down the line.

Jamie
Well, why don’t we take one of the end dates out, and see what happens to the event? I want to make sure it actually works!

The problem isn't taking out the end date, it was us /adding in/ both a start and end date for one day events.

The most likely mess up would have been 'one day' events displaying as Start date: 16/7/2010 End date: 16/7/2010 rather than just Date: 16/7/2010 but it seems we are fin on the event page (as we coded to deal with this situation).

My point was really that we coded everything to do with events on the site based on the understanding that we just needed a start event for a one day event, not both a start and end date. 

Stamen had a bug at their end which meant that if they didn't have an end date (for any event) they displayed the creation date of the page.

The correct solution was for Stamen to fix their bug, not for us to start 'fixing up' our events in a way we never intended them to be used.

Having a quick look round the site it seems we are fine, but this sort of hack is exactly the thing that leads to unexpected behavior and a wasted morning trying to figure out why something is now working differently to the expected.

(btw. re-reading, I realise the tone on thsi response may come across wrong, so just to clarify I'm not grumpy/moaning !!!! More being reflective in terms of "We shouldn't do this in future, I should have said no Stamen need to fix the root cause, this is the sort of thing that ends up opening a can of worms").

My understanding is that Stamen have now fixed the map so can go back to just using a single date field.

:-)
Right. My point was why don’t we try using a single date field, and make sure that it does work.

Ah!!!! You mean see if work son the map now!

Gothca :)

comments.value: See correspondence between Jamie and Liz

...there was a redirect applied last night

http://www.london2012.com/mascots was redirected to http://www.mylondon2012.com/ last night via the Apache conf files.

If this needs to be removed, the Apache file needs to be amended to remove this entry and Apache process bounced. This was done on all webservers – 01 to 06.




Jagdeep Singh Bhambra
Service Engineering Manager
Internet Technology Services
Technology
The changes to the conf files made last night have been reversed. All should be OK now.
They are. It looks lovely.

comments.value:
Is there a fairly simple way to automatically add end dates (that are the same as the start dates) for events that don't have one?  

-----Original Message-----
From: Tom Carden [mailto:tom@stamen.com] 
Sent: 08 July 2010 22:20
To: Kieran Topping
Cc: mike@stamen.com; Liz Goulding; shawn@stamen.com; deborah@stamen.com; jamie@kitsite.com
Subject: Re: Fwd: Incorrect dates in Events on London 2012 map.

Hi Jamie,

I just followed up with Kieran and Liz with a longer diagnosis for the 
incorrect dates. In summary we're not using the event start date in the 
map/timeline unless there's a corresponding end date. It all comes 
through in the API correctly it's just that the swf is falling back to 
creation date in the absence of a full range.

A quick fix on your end would be to require an end date for all events 
before sending them over to our API. But I'm talking to Shawn about 
implementing a fix to the swf as well or instead. We'll keep you posted.

Cheers,

Tom.

> if you'd be able to correct it?
>
> Many thanks in advance,
>
> Kieran
>
>
>


-- 
tom@stamen.com
www.stamen.com
Setting to high priority.
I think Jamie is already on it!

subject: FW: Fwd: Incorrect dates in Events on London 2012 map.
description:
Is there a fairly simple way to automatically add end dates (that are the same as the start dates) for events that don't have one?  

-----Original Message-----
From: Tom Carden [mailto:tom@stamen.com] 
Sent: 08 July 2010 22:20
To: Kieran Topping
Cc: mike@stamen.com; Liz Goulding; shawn@stamen.com; deborah@stamen.com; jamie@kitsite.com
Subject: Re: Fwd: Incorrect dates in Events on London 2012 map.

Hi Jamie,

I just followed up with Kieran and Liz with a longer diagnosis for the 
incorrect dates. In summary we're not using the event start date in the 
map/timeline unless there's a corresponding end date. It all comes 
through in the API correctly it's just that the swf is falling back to 
creation date in the absence of a full range.

A quick fix on your end would be to require an end date for all events 
before sending them over to our API. But I'm talking to Shawn about 
implementing a fix to the swf as well or instead. We'll keep you posted.

Cheers,

Tom.


Kieran Topping wrote:
> Hi Tom, Mike,
> I'm just forwarding this original email to you two, in case you 
> haven't seen it. This appears to still be an issue, independent of the 
> problem with the Edinburgh event.
> I am out of the office on Friday, but Jamie (jamie@kitsite.com 
>  can be contacted in my absence.
> Kind regards,
> Kieran
>
> ---------- Forwarded message ----------
> From: *Kieran Topping* <kieran@kitsite.com 
> Date: Fri, Jul 2, 2010 at 1:46 PM
> Subject: Incorrect dates in Events on London 2012 map.
> To: shawn@stamen.com 
>
>
> Hello Shawn,
>
> I'm investigating a problem whereby incorrect dates are appearing in 
> the London2012 map.
>
> The easiest way for me to describe the problem is with a screenshot. 
> Please see the attached "MapLondon2012.png". This was generated by 
> performing a search for "Open Weekend 2010" and then clicking on the 
> "5" link to the West of Glasgow.
>
> The problem is that the map is displaying the wrong date for the 
> Events. It appears to me that you are using the Event's 
> "creation-date" rather than the "startDate".
>
> When you retrieve the Event object via the api, you get some xml 
> looking like this (nb I've removed all but the relevant elements):  
>
> <page id="2912669" name="Discover Dalriada 2010 - Sound of Jura Bike 
> Safari" display-name="Discover Dalriada 2010 - Sound of Jura Bike 
> Safari" section="Events" 
> path="events/discover-dalriada-2010-sound-of-jura-bike-safari.php" 
> filename="discover-dalriada-2010-sound-of-jura-bike-safari.php" 
> template="Event" is-include="false" encoding="utf-8" lang="en" 
> owner="community-frontend" state="Published" flags="100011101000000" 
> creation-date="201006140849" modification-date="201006291205" 
> publication-date="201006291205" first-publication-date="201006181739" 
> language="en">
>     ...
>     <group iid="300" type="group">
>         <startDate iid="131" type="date">20100725</startDate>
>     </group>
>     ...
> </page>
>
> It appears to me that you're displaying the creation-date 
> ("201006140849", i.e. "14 June 2010") instead of the startDate 
> ("20100725", i.e. "27 July 2010").
>
> Can you confirm whether this is the case please? and also let me know 
> if you'd be able to correct it?
>
> Many thanks in advance,
>
> Kieran
>
>
>


-- 
tom@stamen.com
www.stamen.com

P Please consider the environment before printing this email
Marking as high

Hello Liz,
This event was re-published, this morning at 08:39.
We notified Stamen of this at 09:00.
Stamen downloaded the event data shortly afterwards.
However, the event doesn't yet appear on the map.
I have to conclude from this that the delay is at Stamen's end.
I will forward this question to Stamen.
Thanks – I know that sometimes there is a delay with Stamen. My concern was that this event had been previously published some weeks back, so I wasn’t sure if it’s been missing the whole time!

Sent following email to shawn@stamen.com:
=======================
Hello Shawn,

I have another question from the people at London 2012 regarding an event missing from the map.

At 9am this morning, we notified you - via the following url - that an event had changed:

 http://data.map.london2012.com/kitsite-updates.php?path=events/human-race-inside-the-science-of-sports-medicine.php&action=createorupdate&id=2353976
 
However, a hour or so later, it still hasn't appeared on the map (*), even after a series of Ctrl-refreshes. In fact, it seems to have been deleted. Would you be able to let me know whether there is a problem, please?

Kind regards,

Kieran
(*) http://www.london2012.com/map.php - I searched for "human race" (from the title) "Crichton" (fromn the address) and then just for all "Open Weekend 2010" events, and it appeared in none of the results.

sorry to add to this, but there are still loads of seemingly random events that have a date of June appearing on the map.  I've sent to Stamen, but if you could please just double check that there is nothing different in the XML from those events and the ones that are appearing correctly, I would really appreciate it.  Maybe something to do with having no 'end date' or something??

That might be the case but until I hear back from Stamen, it's very difficult to investigate.
There are quite a a few events that have no end date but that DO appear on the map, but I have no way of knowing whether those are ones that Stamen collected recently.
My suspicion is (I think) the same as yours: i.e. they put in a fix to fix the problem whereby incorrect start dates were being shown, however - in doing so - they also introduced a problem that caused events with no end date to be suppressed.
Until I hear from them tho', I just can't tell. I wish I could!
Totally fine – let’s hope they’re on the case!

As far as I can gather, this problem is distinct from the start/endDate problem.
As far as I can tell, Stamen had a problem geolocating the postcode of this particular event.
It still seems to be missing from the map. Oh! I've just had a look, and the event is now expired. I'm presuming this was deliberate?
Time thus far (including the above): 0.2. This time was spent researching the problem, and emailing Stamen.
Hm. Looks like ruth expired it! I’ll make sure it was on purpose! Let’s leave it for now

Ok, closing this ticket. (do re-open if Ruth/other didn't expire it).
Kieran

Bug.  I think? Am I doing something wrong?

[cid:image001.png@01CB19D6.547E9A30]

Liz Goulding
Senior New Media Producer
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297
Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000
www.london2012.com
www.twitter.com/london2012
Hey Liz, did you click on approve or publish in that view?
yep looks like a bug, will investigate...

Publish. But I just tried with the approve button and got this:
[cid:image001.png@01CB19D8.D413D150]
Set to high priority.
I think this is the same bug as the other one?
yes indeed
Cool. So if i publish an image there, do i need to go back to the event and republish for it to show?

I think you need to go into the event and assign the freshly approved picture, save and publish.

Do you have an event for me to have a look at?

I just approved and image for ‘ordsall festival’ and then went into the event page and didn’t see it there. or any mention that the event had an associated photo. should i? Am slightly concerned that the link isn’t there....
Or do i just need to go and find it, manually, by choosing a photo

Liz, i know that you approved one picture for the ordsall event, did you approve any others or could you approve one more for me and let me know which one please?

Thanks!

I’ve now approved a LOT. And i’ve been manually going into each event, finding the photo i approved, changing the picture, and resaving/publishing.

I have approved (but not manually changed):
Brush hill lnr conservation
Happening hankies
Fresh air festival
Contacting the world 2010
Superb thank you Liz!

Sorry it took me a while to write, and you probably assigned some manually but from now on you should be able to make use of this.

But i'm done with this now. Every time an Event is published the workflow will run and try to find a image and assign it to the Event ~ if there isn't one assigned already. I've tested it and it found the correct ones for the ones i tested it with.
p.s. is it possible for these photos to carry the ‘open weekend 2010’ tag, as well?

Cool – so will it only check on publication, or will it show up in the event page in the CMS before publication? We do need to know when there is an image attached so that we can approve/not approve it. Occasionally people submit things that are inappropriate, so I don’t want things going live without anyone knowing/seeing the photo...
Jamie: It's a bug but I am putting this as billable (subject to approval), as it's 2012-specific code. If you disagree, feel free to amend the billing details.

H iDanny,

This is a mix of lots of things and I take your point but need to be careful not to antagonise Liz as she may see it as a bug, bug.

One issue is that we can't actually do what she wants, as we don't have the data / the CMS has some restrictions.

1) If we assign an image to an Event page [when we create it] and then that page gets published, the image gets published (approved or not). So we can't add an "if" on the Event page saying "if image is approved show it" as publishing the event will have forced the image to be approved/published. We possibly could create a custom workflow for OW images but all of the workflow in the current Default workflow would need to be duplicated. This is what we probably need to do but worried about the knock on effect here, is it better to leave it as it is for the time being [and look again next time we do something like this] seeing as most event have already been uploaded.

* I think the above was the original plan but the issue of the image being published when the page was published it was taken out.

2) Ignoring the above, as it makes this point kind of irrelevant, we can't store a reference on the Image back to the Event on the image as:

      a) we create the Event page after the Image, although I suppose we could try and create a unique key which is stored in the image name/filename and a meta-data field on the Event 
      b) we can't set any meta-data on the image other than tags (which show up on the front end), although we could possibly do this via the filename (I think we can set the filename independently of the image name)

3) There are no references on any of the current images or events, so whatever we did now would only be of use for newly uploaded events. We'd also have a clean up job to do as some pages would have a user assigned / image container and new pages a image meta data field and some display code. 

---

If we we're to go down the route (in future);

1) Create image and set the filename to ow-#eventname#-#uniquenumber#.jpg [assuming this is possible? it may not be possibel to set the filename separately form the image]

2a) Save this is a new /uploads/ow folder (so we can separate them out form the normal user uploads) / create a new tab in the CMS
2b) Alternatively add a 'origin' to the upload servlet and filtering to the approval screen.

3) Store the path to this image on the Event in a metadata 'string' field (not an image container or else it will be published)

4) On the Event page check for the existence of a image field, check if an image with that name exists in a given section and then if has been approved display it. In edit mode we may want to indicate that their is an image that needs approval.

--

I know what Liz would really like is a screen where an image could be assign internally or externally, with a little 'approve/reject' tick-box under it for any external images, but can't see that happening as the development costs outweigh the use.

Sorry long email/response, with no clear conclusion..

Hi Col,

Just did a bit more of an automated test and pleased to say that it working as expected, with cookies enabled I always get sent to the same server, disabled and the servers alternate.

1) Cookies enabled

[jamie@dev ~]$ ./get.sh 
Stage03 Cookie ID: uuuop1t9io680goluibitsjiu6</br>Session cookie set on: 2010-07-08 11:54:14
Stage03 Cookie ID: uuuop1t9io680goluibitsjiu6</br>Session cookie set on: 2010-07-08 11:54:14
Stage03 Cookie ID: uuuop1t9io680goluibitsjiu6</br>Session cookie set on: 2010-07-08 11:54:14
Stage03 Cookie ID: uuuop1t9io680goluibitsjiu6</br>Session cookie set on: 2010-07-08 11:54:14
Stage03 Cookie ID: uuuop1t9io680goluibitsjiu6</br>Session cookie set on: 2010-07-08 11:54:14
Stage03 Cookie ID: uuuop1t9io680goluibitsjiu6</br>Session cookie set on: 2010-07-08 11:54:14

1) Cookies disabled

[jamie@dev ~]$ ./get.sh 
Stage03
Stage04
Stage03
Stage03
Stage04
Stage03
Stage04

Test scripts used:

#!/bin/bash
# cookies enabled
for i in {1..50}
do
wget http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/session-test.php --keep-session-cookies --save-cookies cookies.txt --load-cookies cookies.txt  -O - -o /dev/null | grep Stage | sed -r 's/<h2>Session test - //g' | sed -r 's/<\/h2>Setting session cookie//g'
done

#!/bin/bash
# cookies disabled
for i in {1..50}
do
wget http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/session-test.php  -O - -o /dev/null | grep Stage | sed -r 's/<h2>Session test - //g' | sed -r 's/<\/h2>Setting session cookie//g'
done

comments.value: Currently the Home page of the Volunteering section is displaying the rest of the Get Involved section nav e.g. Business network. Is there any way that we can only show Volunteering nav - i.e. supress Cultural Olympiad etc.?
Marking as high

Yes and no,

The current navigation component is very generic and recursive code shared by almost every page on the site ie. we can't easily just do something different for a given section or least it makes for very messy and unmanageable code if we do that.

What we have done instead is altered the navigation used on the 'Volunteering home' page only.

Although I think that is the only place where the parents sections show anyway?

Jamie
marking as bill separately (part of volunteering)

comments.value: People have been calling here complaining that when they submit a contact us form, they receive a message saying 'could not open socket' (see attached).  Is that likely to be something up at you guys' end do you know, or if not do you know what it means?
i'm looking into this!
Did this get fixed?
I'm not sure, investigation led us into thinking that bt needs to configure sendmail on 5 and 6 to fix this ~
looking at it as well in connection with the form touchup story.

The problem is happening earlier than the emailing - it actually dies off when we try to check the recaptcha code. I've temporarily removed the check, which enables the users to send messages, but potentially dangerous.


To properly resolve, someone at BT should kick the dns settings so that this doesn't end up with an error:

[webcontent@olympic-web01 ~]$ host api-verify.recaptcha.net 
;; connection timed out; no servers could be reached

Can someone please forward this to BT? Thank you.

Jag / Gianfranco - this requires action, although i'm not quite understanding it so you're probably better to judge how quickly. Please see summary of conversation between Janos from Kitsite and me re: issues with our 'contact us' form on the website:

FC: People have been calling here complaining that when they submit a contact us form, they receive a message saying 'could not open socket' (see attached). Is that likely to be something up at you guys' end do you know, or if not do you know what it means?

Janos: The problem is happening earlier than the emailing - it actually dies off when we try to check the recaptcha code. I've temporarily removed the check, which enables the users to send messages, but potentially dangerous.


To properly resolve, someone at BT should kick the dns settings so that this doesn't end up with an error:

[webcontent@olympic-web01 ~]$ host api-verify.recaptcha.net
;; connection timed out; no servers could be reached

Can someone please forward this to BT? Thank you.




-----Original Message-----
Has this all been sorted out?
Did this get resolved in the end, Jag? Conversation seems to have tailed off.
Hi Finn, Jag isn't able to respond directly to support tickets here. It is probably best to email him directly.

Cool, wasn’t sure if you guys were able to let me know how far discussions had gone.

Jag – remember the ‘could not open socket’ issue? Where did you get to with that? See below...
any progress? I'd like to close this ticket...
Solved I believe, thought it was already closed actually, soz...

subject: Contact us issue 'could not open socket'
description: People have been calling here complaining that when they submit a contact us form, they receive a message saying 'could not open socket' (see attached).  Is that likely to be something up at you guys' end do you know, or if not do you know what it means?

comments.value:
Any idea why?  Is it one for stamen, or is there some cache, somewhere, that isn't being cleared?

I know there is a way of 'getting into' the Stamen data and forcing an update ... only I can't seem to find those details.  Does anyone over there have it?

[cid:image001.png@01CB1C24.E1A776C0]

Liz Goulding
Senior New Media Producer
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297
Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000
www.london2012.com
www.twitter.com/london2012

There are 22 results for "junk aliens" when searching the map and 12 results when searching in PostCMS. It is possible that links to 11 events since renamed (with another one added subsequently) have not been removed from the map database. Stamen should be getting an update of the renamed events so that they can  be deleted, this appears not to have happened. We are investigating where to problem might be.
Kieran, assigned to you. I hope that is expected.
Thank you! This is a high priority, please!
Kieran: you appear to have fixed this.

This was largely fixed by the end of yesterday (Monday).
In that - the legacy ones were fixed.
By lunchtime today, it was fixed for all future ones.
Basically, the event renames weren't being dealt with properly. They are now.
NB Danny I set billable days to 0.5. Debatable whether we can charge for all of it, but it is an accurate reflection of how much time I spent.
